author: Tom Olver
title: Chelsea and Arsenal boosted as Helder Costa’s agent wants him at top Premier League club
text:
Arsenal and Chelsea are monitoring Helder Costa (Picture: Getty) Chelsea and Arsenal have both expressed an interest in landing Wolves winger Helder Costa, according to reports.
Ozil: My future does NOT depend on Wenger staying at Arsenal Costa joined Wolves on loan last summer before signing for the Championship outfit permanently in January – and the 23-year-old has gone on to score ten goals in 29 appearances this season.
The Daily Mirror suggest both London clubs were in attendance to watch the ex-Benfica man as Wolves beat Rotherham 1-0 at Molineux on Saturday afternoon.
However, Costa failed to impress in the Championship clash, missing a penalty in the first-half before being subbed off by Paul Lambert in the 66th minute.
Jorge Mendes has high hopes for Helder Costa (Picture: Getty) It’s understood Costa’s agent, Jorge Mendes, is pushing for the Portuguese speedster to move to a big Premier League side in the summer transfer window.
Mendes also works with the likes of Cristiano Ronaldo, David De Gea, David Costa, James Rodriguez and Jose Mourinho.
